transcript.text: well shabbat shalom it is the last great
day or the eighth day of sukkot Sunday
evening October fourth 2015 and I am
actually standing right now in the prior
sugah it was a sukkah put up by a one
woman named Maggie who put a lot of
effort into this suka and you
unfortunately it's at night and I
thought it would be really cool to come
in here when everything's lit up but
unfortunately my ipad doesn't really
pick up much here we can kind of see the
beauty of the various silks and scarves
and just tapestries that are hung here
and it's just a very beautiful there's
two reclining chairs of these pillows
and kinda kinda feels like a Bedouin
tent from the Middle East I wish this
would show up but won't anyway I guess
I'll come back here maybe during the day
portion of the eighth day to come back
here but in any case I just thought I'd
make this YouTube at the beginning of
the last great day the eighth day of
sukkot of course we're commanded to
dwell in sukas or tens for seven days
but on the eighth day it's another
shabbat just like the first day was and
on the eighth day the last great day
Yahshua stood up in John chapter 7 and
it literally says in the middle of that
chapter that he stood up on the last
great day and shouted out that he was
the wellspring of living waters and
anyone who believed in him out of out of
his belly would flow living waters and
he was referring to the ruach ha kodesh
the holy spirit that had not yet been
given because shadowood hadn't been
fulfilled yet or pentecost and then if
you go to revelation 22 you'll read
about how those living waters gush out
from the throne of the Lamb and of yah
sort of tying that so the last great day
is the eighth day again tying us to the
8th millennium when the renewed heavens
and renewed earth will come into being
after the Millennium
and so this last great day is really the
crown jewel of all the annual Sabbath's
because this is commemorating age of the
age Israel without end with no crying no
tears no sickness no pain the trees of
the the leaves of the tree of life will
be for the healing of the nations and
all the sin and frustration and darkness
and disease and things that we went
through here will be but a dream and so
this is a beautiful beautiful high
shabbat this last great day where
Yahshua talks about the giving of the
Ruach the flowing living waters were
reminded of in the last chapter of
Revelation says anyone who's thirsty let
them come and drink freely the Ruach the
Holy Spirit is a free gift for those who
are willing to forsake their sin and and
trust the blood atonement of Yahshua and
to allow Yahshua to tabernacle or
surcoat within our hearts so that we can
be with him in the eighth millennium we
can be with him in the in the age to
come the renewed heavens in the renewed
earth and so this really is the crown
jewel of all the annual Sabbath's the
last great day the eighth day of this
glorious feast of Sukkot is a day of
celebration of feasting of laughter
we're commanded to have the Holy
gathering and and what better place to
be on the last great day than in this
little prayer suka that's not to sleep
and really but to praying and I think
it's beautiful so shabbat shalom
everyone and an happy happy feast of
Sukkot and happy last great day Shalom
